attributes.action: The British people demand of their PM David Cameron to complete his term.
attributes.additional_details:
He did lead a strong campaign, and there already exists a petition for a second EU referendum, that has already reached almost two million signatures, illustrating a huge discontent with the final decision. 
Additionally, David Cameron should not resign as the nation elected him, and whilst he may not agree with the referendum results, he must remain to continue to stabilise the country and do all he can to make it work. The British people are relying on their PM to take the country forward.
attributes.background: David Cameron should not resign as the nation elected him, and whilst he may not agree with the referendum results, he must remain to continue to stabilise the country and do all he can to make it work. The British people are relying on their PM to take the country forward.

rejection.details: The resignation of an individual Minister, including the Prime Minister, is not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole. It is a decision for the individual concerned. The UK Government or Parliament cannot stop a Minister resigning.
